etymology.description: 吕(呂) (lǚ, 'spine') + 隹(隹) (zhuī, 'bird') = phonetic and semantic combination -> 水(水) (shuǐ, 'water') added or 邑(邑) (yì, 'city') corrupted from 吕(呂) -> harmonious
etymology.interpretation: The character 雝 originally combined the phonetic element 吕(呂) from an ancient form similar to 宮 (not the current form 吕) with the semantic element 隹, symbolizing a bird. This was phonetically transformed over time, often incorporating 水 or 邑, contributing to the sense of harmony, as birds and water together evoke natural harmony.
